course_description: A study of major writings of fourth- and fifth-century monasticism, from Aphrahat of Persia to the Rule of Benedict. Themes will include the influence of Jewish traditions, conceptions of God, practices of prayer, and ascetic practices' especially eating habits, celibacy, and the withdrawal from familial relations. (HT609CEE when offered as a Contextual Education Elective) (Theology)
